instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc io error
threads.message:
Board originally had mild water damage with quarter fan spin every few seconds. After replacing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7502</RESISTOR> it turns on  but high fan spin.

Ran apple asd and all I get is SMC IO error. SMC area is spotless and never had any water damage.

Replace SMC to start or check something else?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc io error
threads.message:
Post the exact error message from ASD.
Does it report one error only?
Did you try known good trackpad and cable?

Also check <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc io error
threads.message:
[ATTACH type="full" width="200px"]41812._xfImport[/ATTACH] Attached is exact error from asd

yes itâ€™s only reporting the smc io error as pictured.

yes using tested working  good trackpad and cable

<SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc io error
threads.message:
The error reffers to palm rest, Ts0P...
So you have problem with trackpad, its flex, or broken traces, bad connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc io error
threads.message: Are you sure that is what the error is related to? Removed connector and traces look perfectly fine yet I am still getting fast fan spin

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc io error
threads.message:
Ambient Light Sensor is also placed in the same bus.
But the error reffers only to palm rest; seems that ALS is correctly detected...
Check continuity for SCL/SDA lines from J5800.
Also check <RESISTOR>R5922</RESISTOR>/23.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc io error
threads.message: This can be marked as solved. Soldered another connector and now all is good
